page.title: 09Peening Quarter Farm
page.content:
Peening Quarter Farm has 4 barns altogether, the buildings are mainly modern, of steel and asbestos construction. In winter their bullocks are housed in the central building with the hay stored on either side so that it can be thrown straight in to the bullocks without otherwise having to move it. In summer they clean the bullocks out.
Mr. Brown has 14 acres on the farm but he rents more land all round Wittersham. The animals are kept mainly for meat; there are 70 bullocks, 3 cows and 8 calves, the cows are each given a name. Mr. Brown has 300 ewes and 4 rams which are kept for wool and he employs 2 people on the farm. There is one field for corn and 2 ponds.
